item.source: How can I make the owner have a higher combat lv than normal players?

item.title: How can I make the owner have a higher combat lv than normal players?
item.dc:creator: @Vanack Vanack
item.description:
@Vanack wrote:

I changed the code picture, but what you would do, would be doing what a stregnth potion would do. Temporarily increase your level, but not the exp. So find this on a new char:

[SKILLS]
character-skill = 0 1 0
character-skill = 1 1 0
character-skill = 2 1 0
character-skill = 3 10 1155
character-skill = 4 1 0
character-skill = 5 1 0
character-skill = 6 1 0

and change it to this:
[SKILLS]
character-skill = 0 100 0 << Level 1 exp, with level 100 attack. - ADVANTAGE
character-skill = 1 1 0
character-skill = 2 1 0
character-skill = 3 10 1155 << level 10 exp, with level 10 hp. - NORMAL
character-skill = 4 1 0
character-skill = 5 1 0
character-skill = 6 1 0

This player would have an advantage do to the temporarily increased skill you changed, but after death, if returns to normal. Did this help?

Read full topic
item.source: How can I make the owner have a higher combat lv than normal players?

item.title: How can I make the owner have a higher combat lv than normal players?
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“Vanack, post:3, topic:153536”]First of all, the max level (99, 100, 135, 185, or 200) are set for not just the players or the owners, yet for everyone. The only way to bypass this feature is to change your level, yet no the xp. As you see, the exp stays the same, at the point of level 45 defence, though the level is now raised from 45, to 9999983.

[SKILLS] character-skill = 0 100 2008000888 character-skill = 1 9999983 61800 << EMAMPLE<< character-skill = 2 100 2008000000 character-skill = 3 100 2008016895 character-skill = 4 100 2000006000 character-skill = 5 52 125000 character-skill = 6 100 2008660000 character-skill = 7 100 2008000000 character-skill = 8 100 2008000000 character-skill = 9 100 2008000000 character-skill = 10 100 2008000000 character-skill = 11 100 2008000000 character-skill = 12 100 2008000000 character-skill = 13 100 2008000000 character-skill = 14 100 2058000000 character-skill = 15 100 2058000000 character-skill = 16 100 2058000000 character-skill = 17 100 2058000000 character-skill = 18 135 2058000055 character-skill = 19 135 2058000000 character-skill = 20 100 2058000000 character-skill = 21 135 2058000000 character-skill = 22 135 2058000000 character-skill = 23 135 2058000000 character-skill = 24 135 2058000000

Thats all I can’t say about this atm. Hope it helped![/quote]

That was an Ok tut, Except, I could barley understand what you typed.

Read full topic

item.source: How can I make the owner have a higher combat lv than normal players?

item.title: How can I make the owner have a higher combat lv than normal players?
item.dc:creator: @Vanack Vanack
item.description:
@Vanack wrote:

First of all, the max level (99, 100, 135, 185, or 200) are set for not just the players or the owners, yet for everyone. The only way to bypass this feature is to change your level, yet no the xp. As you see, the exp stays the same, at the point of level 45 defence, though the level is now raised from 45, to 9999983.

[SKILLS] character-skill = 0 100 0 << Level 1 exp, with level 100 attack. - CHANGED FOR ADVANTAGE character-skill = 1 1 0 character-skill = 2 1 0 character-skill = 3 10 1155 << level 10 exp, with level 10 hp. - NORMAL character-skill = 4 1 0 character-skill = 5 1 0 character-skill = 6 1 0

Thats all I can’t say about this atm. Hope it helped!

Read full topic
